See also: apfel and Äpfel

German[edit]

German Wikipedia has articles on:
Apfel
Wikipedia de

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Appel (colloquial; northern and central Germany)

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German apfel, from Old High German apful, from Proto-Germanic *aplaz (compare Dutch appel, West Frisian apel, English apple), from Proto-Indo-European *h₂ébōl.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈapfəl/, [ˈʔapfəl], [ˈʔapfl̩], [ˈʔapɸəl], [ˈʔapɸl̩]
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Apfel m (genitive Apfels, plural Äpfel, diminutive Äpfelchen n or Äpfelein n or Äpflein n)

  1. apple (fruit)
